title: AREAS OF REDUCED MOBILITY
fullText:
When working in areas of reduced mobility, care should be taken due to the restriction of movement and the inability to readily escape from the area.
Examples of areas of reduced mobility are as follows:
(a) Restricted areas in and around switchboards.
(b) Ceiling and roof spaces.
(c) Spaces under floors.
(d) Ladders, scaffolds or EWPs.
(e) Trenches.
(f) Pits or tunnels.
(g) Confined spaces.
NOTE AS 2865 identifies the hazards when entering and working in confined spaces. It sets out the precautions to be taken to prevent occupational injuries and fatalities associated with such work environments.
